intro: Zollikoferia stenocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed zollikoferia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, succulent stems. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the rainy season. Its leaves are typically narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native environment. Zollikoferia stenocephala is often found growing in rocky soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
